verse: When Samuel was old, he named his sons judges of Israel to rule over the people and be their deliverers.
His first son, Joel, and his second son, Abijah, were judges in Beersheba,
but they were not like Samuel. They profited from dishonesty, took bribes, and fostered injustice.
So the elders of Israel gathered and came to Ramah to tell Samuel.
This request—“appoint a king to rule us”—bothered Samuel, so he prayed to the Eternal One
So Samuel told the people who were asking for a king what the Eternal One had said.
After Samuel had heard their demands, he told the Eternal One what they had said.
